messages.title: FOR THE CHANGE WE NEED
messages.content: Changes have been made to constituency boundaries which will come into force at the General Election to be held in the next few weeks. This follows the recommendations of the Parliamentary Boundary Commission which has reviewed changes in population across the parliamentary groups, each electoral division has a similar number of voters. You will now vote in the Wycombe constituency. Wycombe is one of the oldest constituencies in the country, having continuously elected members of parliament since 1295 in the reign of King Edward I.

leaflet.personalStatement: Steven Baker is the new Conservative candidate for Wycombe and intends to carry on the good work of Paul Goodman who is returning to his previous work in journalism. Steve has real life experience outside politics. He served as an RAF engineer before working in business as a consulting software engineer and manager. He has worked internationally with governments, businesses, and with non-profit organisations. He values family, freedom, responsibility, enterprise, and nation. He believes society and its family model shapes values, and that virtues predominate with prosperity, justice, and freedom. He believes that everyone should be equal before the law.

images.caption: VOTE STEVEN BAKER FOR THE CHANGE WE NEED

leaflet.additionalNotes: Steve and his wife first moved to the area in 2007, when she began working at RAF Air Command in Walters Ash whilst he commuted daily to London. His wife's final posting meant they lived for nine months in Brize Norton last year. They are now back living in High Wycombe.
